intro: Genista lobelii subsp. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed broom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
